channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Required registration
channel.description:
It's quite disappointing that there is so many guests than members.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/YwG5wzT.png[/img]
Seriously? There hundreds of people that are here just to download something and read few tutorials without even putting effort to register? I think we shall make it simple, quests users may view 10 threads, after they must register to see more.
This way, we will enhance the communication and interaction at MoparScape. As myself, I am tired seeing some of my threads getting "1 Members and 7 Guests are viewing this topic." It's more than frustrating.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Required registration
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Why should we force someone to join if they just want to download a source?

Read full topic

item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

Svitkona:

in fact forcing them to actually register might just turn them away because they don’t want to go through the registration process.

That’s why

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Required registration
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

To be honest, I haven’t thought about it before that way. And I must say, I agree with you. However, I still think that it will benifit on the community activity. Otherwise, we probably should keep it the way it is. It’s just been annoying to see so much guests rather that real members.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Required registration
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

nolan2131:

An intelligent person would take other communities completely out of the equation and do it for our own good.

I never supported the idea to begin with. I was stating that this suggestion was most likely based off of the other communities, since reading the replies, you guys want to do exactly what the other communities are doing.

Explain the benefits of forced registration?
My example on why I’m against it:
I have a R-locus and R-S account, but I rarely use them. I go on R-S when I have an error I can’t solve nor can people I know on here (or they’re not here/busy whatever). Or I’ll go on there to snoop the downloads or tutorials and see if there’s anything worth a damn.
As for R-Locus, the only time I’m on that account is because I have to sign in to access something or to set up an advertisement page. Other than that, I don’t even browse the site.

That being said, sure this may cause a ‘spike’ in registrations, and increase them overall, but I would not consider that bringing life to these forums if they’re only registering to see content.

Read full topic

but yeah no this is a stupid idea. isn’t that what google or something does? it’s fudgeing annoying

r-locus does it too. They hide the code and links from non-registered members.
R-S does the whole 5 post view a day.
Nice to see you guys want to mimic other communities.[/quote][quote=“nolan2131, post:21, topic:538390”]An intelligent person would take other communities completely out of the equation and do it for our own good.[/quote]
Exactly, maybe because R-S has the good idea there.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Required registration
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

nolan2131:

I support this, it’s not hassle for people to have to log in periodically, it’s just being lazy if you don’t make it remember your password. Make the forums more active IMO. 1/6 member to guest ratio is pretty bad.

Lazy? Maybe some of us browse on public computers, or don’t want the occasional person using your device to see your dirty secrets?

It is a hassle to type in a randomly generated password on a mobile device, especially when all I want to do is see whats new in a category

Read full topic
